answers.answer: Around how many weeks do they do that test?

I was told not to eat anything after midnight the night before and only drink water. There is a possibility of getting nauseous because of not eating,  I would suggest taking a snack to eat immediately after the test is complete . I would not suggest eating the morning of this could certainly cause you to fail the test and I would avoid taking the 3 hour test if possible. Its much more unpleasant than the one hour.
And depending on your Dr and risk factors for gestational diabetes they do it between 24-28 weeks .
Ill be 28 weeks I think they do them around this time
Mine is next week at 930 nd the Jus told me nothing for 2 hours before... but I guess all drs r different nd by states too probly. Good luck hope all goes well:)
Your supposed to fast that morning, and when you go there they will ask if you've eaten. And if you have, they'll tell you to do it another day. Only water
They didn't tell me anything about not eating before the test, just during the hour wait. I get my results next week so I'm not sure if I failed or not..

I got mine done at 28 weeks I believe, and they told me I couldn't eat or drink anything after u drink the orange thing they give you. I ate before I went to the clinic. I went to my appointment & waited til the hour was up then they did my blood test.. at my next appointment after that he never mentioned anything about my test so I'm assuming it was okay.
They didn't tell me anything about not eating, and didn't ask whether I had. I had cereal about an hour before and passed easily both times.

Mine was at 27 weeks. I was told not to eat after midnight and if you have to eat or drink something make sure it is very low sugar or no sugar would be better. I ate a banana the morning of and I was at 34 and you have to be less than 37 to pass, so I was very close.

I did mine on Friday and I was allowed to eat, they recommend I do eat, I had a soup and sandwich right before and drank lots of water and then nothing for the hour after drinking the orange drink, I got my results today, I did not fail nor do I have gestational diabetes, I was worried about failing it, I was 28+5 when I did it
You don't have to fast for the 1 hour test, only the 3 hour test
I was told nothing to eat after midnight water was ok as long as I didn't get sick
I'm pretty sure that's only for the 3 hour test, or maybe a different test, on the back of the sheet my OB gave me it had no specifications about fasting or anything, only for the 3 hr test
Some docs want you to fast and some dont. Just fast if they say too and if they dont just make sure to not have a lot of sugar before hand

I was told to fast but I went to the doctors appointment early bc I was afarid I was going to be sick but I got sick anyways since my morning sickness comes up from time to time again but they lady said that it was ok if I threw it up...im 28 weeks also

For the 1hr glucose test they didn't tell me not to eat, but I called in to check, they told me it was fine to eat some cereal or a little something for breakfast, just not to eat anything sugary like pancakes and stuff.They told me you only have to fast after midnight if u take the three hour one
I wouldn't worry about the test too much in reality if you're going to fail, you're going to fail. And if you do, It's better to know you have gestational diabetes than not know you have it :)

mines for 2hours.fasting beforehand for 6 hours. having food in your stomach is going to effect how you process the sugars. they should take 2blood samples one during and another after. eating could stuff up results.
Well I eat a biscuit. 5 hrs before my test and passed by one pt so they let me slide through

question: Okay my doctor didn't give me a special diet or anything I take my test at 10 am and was wondering if I got a biscuit from hardees a few hours before and drank water will i fail my test im afraid if I dont eat I will be sick
